IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ADVANCING COMMUNITY SUPPORT AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE LIVING WITH DISABILITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ST. JOHN'S COMMUNITY SERVICES-PENNSYLVANIA'S MISSION IS TO ADVANCE COMMUNITY SUPPORT AND OPPORTUNITIES TO PEOPLE LIVING WITH DISABILITIES. THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES TO HELP CHILDREN AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES SUCCESSFULLY BECOME A PART OF THE COMMUNITY OF THEIR CHOICE THROUGH SUPPORT PROVIDED BY DEDICATED STAFF. SOMETIMES SUCCESSES ARE MEASURED IN IMPERCEPTIBLE WAYS - FROM AN INDIVIDUAL'S FIRST STEP INTO THE COMMUNITY, TO AN EMPLOYER'S GREATER APPRECIATION FOR THE TALENTS OF PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, TO STAFF MEMBERS TAKING OWNERSHIP TO CREATE A MORE EFFECTIVE PROCESS TO SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS, TO SUCCESSFUL ADVOCACY OF GOVERNMENT FOR GREATER FINANCIAL SUPPORT AND ACCESS. OUR MANY VOICES UNITE UNDER ONE MISSION AND MEET OPPORTUNITY WITH ACTION TO CREATE SOCIAL CHANGE AND ENABLE PEOPLE TO LIVE THEIR DREAMS AND CONTRIBUTE TO THEIR COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.Desc: ST. JOHN'S COMMUNITY SERVICES - PENNSYLVANIA IS A SUBSIDIARY CORPORATION OF ST. JOHN'S COMMUNITY SERVICES. THE PARENT CORPORATION IS SEPARATELY INCORPORATED IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND GOVERNED BY A VOLUNTEER BOARD OF TRUSTEES. EACH OF THE SUBSIDIARIES, INCLUDING SJCS-PA, HAS A LOCAL VOLUNTEER BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND IS SUPERVISED BY LOCAL LEADERSHIP, WITH ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES LOCATED IN THE STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA WHERE THE SUBSIDIARY IS INCORPORATED. SJSC-PA CONTRACTS TO USE THE COPYRIGHTED NAME "ST. JOHN'S COMMUNITY SERVICES AND PURCHASES VARIOUS ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT SERVICES FROM THE PARENT CORPORATION. AS A CONDITION OF THE CONTRACT, THE PARENT CORPORATION ESTABLISHES AND MONITORS SERVICE QUALITY STANDARDS AND THE SUBSIDIARY ACCEPTS THESE SERVICE STANDARDS.THE ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT SERVICES AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THAT THE PARENT CORPORATION PROVIDES INCLUDE: ACCOUNTING, CASH MANAGEMENT, EVALUATION AND STRATEGIC PLANNING, COMMUNICATION AND INFORMATION DISSEMINATION, HUMAN RESOURCES, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY, QUALITY ASSURANCE, CORPORATE COMPLIANCE AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT. EACH OF THESE SUPPORT SERVICES IS INDIVIDUALLY TAILORED TO MEET THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF THIS SUBSIDIARY CORPORATION AND ITS DISTINCTIVE CULTURAL AS WELL AS FINANCIAL STATUS. THESE SERVICES ASSIST SJCS-PA TO MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE CONTRACTS, LAWS AND REGULATIONS UNDER WHICH IT OPERATES. SJCS-PA OPERATES UNDER ITS OWN OPERATING POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND LOCAL LEADERSHIP. ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT SERVICES ARE BILLED BY THE PARENT CORPORATION, ST. JOHN'S COMMUNITY SERVICES, TO THE SUBSIDIARY CORPORATION, SJCS-PA, AT A LOW FIXED RATE CONSISTENT WITH NATIONAL STANDARDS.TO FURTHER THE AGENCY'S MISSION OF ADVANCING COMMUNITY SUPPORT AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE LIVING WITH DISABILITIES, THE PARENT CORPORATION SETS QUALITY STANDARDS CONSISTENT WITH THE MISSION THAT MUST BE MET BY THE SJCS-PA SUBSIDIARY IN THE PROVISION OF SERVICES. THOSE SERVICES MUST FOSTER INCLUSION, SELF DIRECTION, ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY, RELATIONSHIP DEVELOPMENT AND CHOICE. MEETING AND MAINTAINING THESE STANDARDS IS A REQUIREMENT FOR THE CONTINUATION OF THE ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT CONTRACT AND USE OF THE CORPORATE NAME. THE PARENT CORPORATION ALSO PROVIDES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING TO THE SJCS-PA SUBSIDIARY CORPORATION TO FACILITATE THE ATTAINMENT OF THESE ESTABLISHED STANDARDS. PEOPLE RECEIVING SERVICES THROUGH THE ST. JOHN'S SUBSIDIARY MUST MEET LOCAL FUNDING SOURCES AND THE SUBSIDIARY'S UNIQUE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR EACH SPECIFIC SERVICE.TYPES OF COMMUNITY SUPPORTS AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE LIVING WITH DISABILITIES THAT SJCS-PA PROVIDED DURING THE 2015 FISCAL YEAR INCLUDED EMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION. THE TOTAL NUMBER OF PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES SUPPORTED IN FY 2015 WAS AS FOLLOWS: - EMPLOYMENT SERVICES: 35 ADULTS PARTICIPATED IN JOB DEVELOPMENT, COACHING, PLACEMENT AND ON-GOING SUPPORT IN JOBS WORKING ALONGSIDE EMPLOYEES WITHOUT DISABILITIES.- COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION: NO ADULTS PARTICIPATED IN THIS NEW SJCS-PA SERVICE THAT PROVIDES VOLUNTEER AND COMMUNITY EXPLORATION, SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ADOPTED THE INCOME TAX STANDARD FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE ORGANIZATION EVALUATED ITS TAX POSITIONS AND DETERMINED THAT THEY ARE MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT TO BE SUSTAINED ON EXAMINATION. THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW AND EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES. THE TAX RETURNS FOR THE FISCAL YEARS ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2011 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 30, 2015 ARE OPEN TO EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES.

FOR THE PURPOSES OF DETERMINING COMPENSATION, THE FILING ORGANIZATION, ST. JOHN'S COMMUNITY SERVICES PENNSYLVANIA RELIED ON THE SOLE MEMBER TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT & CEO, OTHER OFFICERS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES. THE RELATED ORGANIZATION USED THE FOLLOWING PRACTICES FOR ESTABLISHING COMPENSATION FOR SUCH INDIVIDUALS: WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTS OF THE OFFICERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE ALL POWERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS EXCEPT THE AUTHORITY TO AMEND THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS; TO ELECT OR REMOVE DIRECTORS, ADVISORS, AND OFFICERS; AND TO TAKE ANY OTHER ACTIONS PROHIBITED BY THE D.C. NONPROFIT CORPORATIONS ACT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOLE MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION IS ST. JOHN'S COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOLE MEMBER APPOINTS THE MEMBERS AND SELECTS THE OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOLE MEMBER MAY ADOPT, AMEND OR REPEAL ANY PROVISION OF THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION OR BYLAWS, AND SHALL RATIFY ANY AMENDMENT OR REPEAL OF SAID DOCUMENTS PROPOSED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE SOLE MEMBER SHALL RATIFY THIS ORGANIZATION'S ANNUAL BUDGET, AS WELL AS ANY POLICY DECISIONS BY THIS ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS REGARDING THE CORPORATION'S ENDOWMENT, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, RATIFICATION OF MAJOR UNBUDGETED WITHDRAWALS OR EXPENDITURES, SELECTION AND CHANGES IN FUND MANAGERS, AND ANY CHANGES IN INVESTMENT/REINVESTMENT POLICIES AND STRATEGY. THE SOLE MEMBER MAY ACT THROUGH ITS BOARD OF TRUSTEES, OR BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD, THROUGH ITS EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. WHENEVER POSSIBLE, THE PRESIDENT OF THE SOLE MEMBER SHALL COMMUNICATE TO THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN WRITING THE DECISIONS OF THE SOLE MEMBER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WILL BE REVIEWED IN DETAIL BY MANAGEMENT STAFF, PRESENTED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, AND MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN THE EVENT ANY VOTING TRUSTEE HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WHICH MIGHT PROPERLY LIMIT SUCH TRUSTEE'S FAIR AND IMPARTIAL PARTICIPATION IN BOARD DELIBERATIONS OR DECISIONS, SUCH TRUSTEE SHALL INFORM THE BOARD AS TO THE CIRCUMSTANCES OF SUCH CONFLICT. IF THOSE CIRCUMSTANCES REQUIRE THE NONPARTICIPATION OF THE AFFECTED TRUSTEE, THE BOARD MAY NONETHELESS REQUEST FROM SUCH TRUSTEE ANY APPROPRIATE NON-CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION WHICH MIGHT INFORM ITS DECISIONS. "CONFLICT OF INTEREST," AS REFERRED TO HEREIN, SHALL INCLUDE, BUT SHALL NOT BE LIMITED TO, ANY TRANSACTION BY OR WITH THE CORPORATION IN WHICH A TRUSTEE HAS A DIRECT OR INDIRECT PERSONAL INTEREST, OR ANY TRANSACTION IN WHICH A TRUSTEE IS UNABLE TO EXERCISE IMPARTIAL JUDGMENT OR OTHERWISE ACT IN THE BEST INTERESTS OF THE CORPORATION. NO TRUSTEE OF THE CORPORATION SHALL CAST A VOTE, NOR TAKE PART IN THE FINAL DELIBERATION IN ANY MATTER IN WHICH HE OR SHE, MEMBERS OF HIS OR HER IMMEDIATE FAMILY OR ANY ORGANIZATION TO WHICH SUCH TRUSTEE HAS ALLEGIANCE, HAS A PERSONAL INTEREST THAT MAY BE SEEN AS COMPETING WITH THE INTEREST OF THE CORPORATION. ANY TRUSTEE WHO BELIEVES HE OR SHE MAY HAVE SUCH A CONFLICT-OF-INTEREST SHALL SO NOTIFY THE BOARD PRIOR TO DELIBERATION ON THE MATTER IN QUESTION, AND THE BOARD SHALL MAKE THE FINAL DETERMINATION AS TO WHETHER ANY TRUSTEE HAS A CONFLICT-OF-INTEREST IN ANY MATTER. THE MINUTES OF THE BOARD MEETING SHALL REFLECT DISCLOSURE OF ANY CONFLICT-OF-INTEREST AND THE RECUSAL OF THE INTERESTED TRUSTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, NOR ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
ACQUISITION OF COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENTAL SERVICES HOUSING AND -18,022. JWC HOUSING

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VII AND PART IX
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE STATE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION WAS PAID FROM ST. JOHN'S COMMUNITY SERVICES, THE PARENT ORGANIZATION. ACCORDING TO THEIR AGREEMENT, ST. JOHN'S COMMUNITY SERVICES PROVIDED THE MANAGEMENT/ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES TO ST. JOHN'S COMMUNITY SERVICES - PENNSYLVANIA AND REIMBURSED BY ST. JOHN'S COMMUNITY SERVICES - PENNSYLVANIA FOR THEIR SERVICES. PER IRS INSTRUCTIONS, THE STATE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION WAS REPORTED ON BOTH PART VII AND PART IX OF THE FORM 990.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: ST JOHN'S COMMUNITY SERVICES DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: PROVIDE HOUSING FOR LOW INCOME HANDICAPPED ADULTS
PROVIDE HOUSING FOR LOW INCOME AND MODERATE INCOME HANDICAPPED ADULTS
